intro: Pterygodium venosum, commonly known as the veiny pterygodium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves with prominent veins. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are clustered in small umbels. Pterygodium venosum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
